VEC.Q: How many chords are in this chord chart?
How many outer arcs are in this chord chart?

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Natural Gas?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Natural Gas is arc {Oil}.

SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the counterclockwise direction from arc Wind?
SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Wind is arc {Oil}.

VPR.Q: Which arc has the largest output flow in this chord chart?
Which arc has the largest input flow in this chord chart?

VE.Q: What is the flow value from Natural Gas to Oil in the chord chart?
What is the flow value from Oil to Wind in the chord chart?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value between Oil and Natural Gas in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum flow value between Oil and Natural Gas is {197}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum flow value between Wind and Natural Gas in the chord chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum flow value between Wind and Natural Gas is {199}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum flow value in the chord chart?
What is the minimum flow value in the chord chart?

SC.Q: What is the total flow output from Wind?
SC.A: The total flow output from Wind is {581}.

SC.Q: What is the total flow input by Oil?
SC.A: The total flow input by Oil is {451}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 445? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {503} from {Oil} to {Wind}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow less than 198? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {69} from {Natural Gas} to {Oil}, a flow of {197} from {Oil} to {Natural Gas}.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow between 198 and 290? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.
NF.A: There is a flow of {199} from {Wind} to {Natural Gas}.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Wind to Natural Gas or from Oil to Natural Gas?
NC.A: The flow from {Wind} to {Natural Gas} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Natural Gas to Oil, from Oil to Wind, or from Wind to Natural Gas?
NC.A: The flow from {Oil} to {Wind} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?
MSR.A: The category with the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow is {Oil}.

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Oil} and {Wind}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Oil, Arc Wind, Arc Natural Gas}.
